alert.note: Alert for Clark; Ford; Kiowa (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 17 at 6:25PM CDT until July 17 at 7:15PM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN FORD...WEST CENTRAL KIOWA AND NORTHEASTERN CLARK COUNTIES... At 625 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Bucklin, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and tennis ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Ford, west central Kiowa and northeastern Clark Counties. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.50 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
